name: market for clefting of energy wood | clefting of energy wood | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11970/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'clefting of energy wood', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;This is delivering the service of clefting of energy wood.  The service represents  1 productive machine hour (PMH), referring to the operational time of the tractor machine including breaks up to 15 minutes. The tractor is powered by a clefting device with a diesel consumption of 7 l/PMH, and an engine power of 80 kW. It includes machinery infrastructure, the input of diesel fuel, lubricants/greases,  transportation, emissions, end-of-life. The input of wood is excluded and should be added manually.

This activity starts with the service generation.


This activity ends with the service supplied to its consumers. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/022:Logging/0220:Logging
